titleStmt.title: W. M. Fisher et al. to James F. Robinson
CWG8696

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, James F. Robinson: Governor's Official Correspondence File, Petitions for Pardons, Remissions, and Respites, 1862-1863

body.p:
Honbl J. F Robinson
Govenor of Kentucky

The undersigned your petitioners would respectfully state that at the Aug term of the Carroll Circuit Court 1862 W H Ruggles was fined $500 -- for shooting at Wm Morely -- We state that both the parties were on a spree and we believe that Ruggles had no intention of hurting Morely -- Morely dared him to shoot and he fired -- The verdict of the jury surprised all in attendance. Your petitioners believing this case deserves executive clemency repectfully request your excellency to remit said fine --

W. M Fisher.
J M. Collyer
D W Hogan
Jas, K. Pope
John Hogan Late Clk
H C C C
C N. Stringfellow
B E N reben
E Webster
R. T. Mclearm
Josep Vance
Enoile Abbett
G G Minish
J W Lingenfelter
Allan Hanks C C C C
D. S. Hanks D. C.
A T Guthrie
W L Smith
Jno. F. Gaunt D. S.
W. A. Dean
A V Carlisle D, S,
W. P. Masterson
J. J. Orr County atto
A R Gaunt C C C C
Ed D Hogan D Clk
R. W. Masterson J. C. C. C.
Geo W, Anderson
George. Henke
R H, V Jett
W H Van Pelt Rep

W. H. Ruggles Pettn
Carroll Cir Ct
$500 } Assault
One half fine remitted in this case

J F Robinson
Issd Feby 19. 1863
Mr Vanpelt
